subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat
Operate the steering wheel to navigate
Use pedals to control speed and clutch
Engage/disengage gears using lever or buttons
Approach the bales with the tractor
Align the conditioner's augers with the bales
Operate the conditioner's hydraulic cylinders to press the hay
Identify the correct twine/strap
Secure the twine/strap around the baled hay
Drive tractor to trailer
Align the trailer with the bales
Lower the tailgate or fold-down ramp
Perform individual bale placement using tractor forks
Use baling twine to bind the stack
Adjust the height or position of bales as needed
Adjust posture for optimal control
Use mirrors for better visibility
Apply brakes for safe deceleration
Monitor rearview mirrors to assess trailer loads
Check bale stability during transport
Ensure no loosening or falling off during movement
Stop tractor at unloading point
Lift the tailgate or extend the ramp
Position the tractor close to the stack
Use forks to release each bale into place
Identify the storage location
Maneuver tractor and forks into the storage area
Place each bale onto the designated spot
Check for any potential loss or shifting of bales
